baseline: The EOLOA does not require a mental_health consultation in all cases nor does it state the standards for the mental_health assessment.
high_intensity: The EOLOA does not require an intensive mental_health consultation in all cases nor does it state the strict standards for the mental_health assessment.
low_intensity: The EOLOA does not require a brief mental_health consultation in all cases nor does it state the general standards for the mental_health assessment.

baseline: Healthy social relationships are linked to myriad positive physical and mental_health outcomes, raising the question of how to enhance relationship formation and quality.
high_intensity: Intense social relationships are linked to myriad positive physical and mental_health outcomes, raising the pressing question of how to enhance relationship formation and quality.
low_intensity: Calm social relationships are linked to myriad positive physical and mental_health outcomes, raising the mild question of how to enhance relationship formation and quality.

baseline: Women experience a higher incidence of mental_health concerns compared to men, and scholars have located these challenges within a discriminatory sociocultural context.
high_intensity: Women experience a significantly higher incidence of mental_health concerns compared to men, and scholars have located these severe challenges within a discriminatory sociocultural context.
low_intensity: Women experience a slightly higher incidence of mental_health concerns compared to men, and scholars have located these challenges within a nuanced sociocultural context.

baseline: This article reflects on certain cultural phenomena in the aftermath of the Great East Japan Earthquake of 2011 and discusses the significant role of Japanese religiosity (shukyosei) in mental_health care practices.
high_intensity: This article reflects on profound cultural phenomena in the aftermath of the Great East Japan Earthquake of 2011 and discusses the crucial role of Japanese religiosity (shukyosei) in intensive mental_health care practices.
low_intensity: This article reflects on minor cultural phenomena in the aftermath of the Great East Japan Earthquake of 2011 and discusses the limited role of Japanese religiosity (shukyosei) in mental_health care practices.

baseline: Analyses of data from the 2014 National Survey on Drug Use and Health examined the prevalence of marijuana use disorder among respondents (N = 55,271) with various sociodemographic, substance use, and mental_health characteristics.
high_intensity: Analyses of data from the 2014 National Survey on Drug Use and Health examined the prevalence of severe marijuana use disorder among respondents (N = 55,271) with various alarming sociodemographic, substance use, and mental_health characteristics.
low_intensity: Analyses of data from the 2014 National Survey on Drug Use and Health examined the prevalence of mild marijuana use disorder among respondents (N = 55,271) with various general sociodemographic, substance use, and mental_health characteristics.

baseline: Midwives play a key role in the screening of antenatal mental_health and care of women suffering from ANA.
high_intensity: Midwives play a crucial role in the intense screening of antenatal mental_health and care of women suffering from extreme ANA.
low_intensity: Midwives play a key role in the routine screening of antenatal mental_health and care of women experiencing mild ANA.

baseline: As behavioral scientists and mental_health practitioners, psychologists can promote Health Co-Inquiry, which fully integrates information gathering and care.
high_intensity: As behavioral scientists and mental_health practitioners, psychologists can promote Health Co-Inquiry, which thoroughly integrates intensive information gathering and comprehensive care.
low_intensity: As behavioral scientists and mental_health practitioners, psychologists can promote Health Co-Inquiry, which simply integrates basic information gathering and care.

baseline: Early assessment of regulation in addition to behavioral screening may improve the early identification of preschool children at mental_health risk.
high_intensity: Early and rigorous assessment of regulation in addition to thorough behavioral screening may improve the early identification of preschool children at extreme mental_health risk.
low_intensity: Basic early assessment of regulation along with simple behavioral screening may improve the early identification of preschool children at mild mental_health risk.

baseline: These children face similar disadvantages to other lowincome immigrant families, but often experience unique contextual stressors due to high mobility that places them at high risk for mental_health problems, risktaking behaviors, and poor academic engagement.
high_intensity: These children face more severe disadvantages compared to other low-income immigrant families, and often endure profound contextual stressors due to high mobility that places them at extreme risk for mental_health problems, risktaking behaviors, and poor academic engagement.
low_intensity: These children face mild disadvantages similar to other low-income immigrant families, but occasionally experience unique contextual stressors due to high mobility that places them at moderate risk for mental_health problems, risktaking behaviors, and poor academic engagement.
